column4: I have a SATA dvd drive that I'm trying to mount in ubuntu, but I cant find the device. Are there any tricks to getting it to show up
they are usually named /dev/sr0, /dev/sr1 etc. Try running eject /dev/sr0 etc. and see if the tray opens
that does not eject the drive, I think it may be a different device
Not what I expected. Which os version is this?
that's bad, that suggests it isn't even seeing the dvd drive. Do you have 'Disk Utility' somewhere under the system menu?
close enough, Run it and see if it lists the disks and dvd drive...
I don't think the dvd drive has been recognised by the kernel. This usually means a hardware problem. Is it a known working device? Are all the connections good etc....
'device works' -- you mean it has power and the blinky light comes on?
yes, it works in a different machine. I'm going to try a live cd in another cd drive
before you do that, I would try the drive in a different sata port (you will need to reboot). Just a hunch....
the drive shows up in bios.
weird. Sorry, I'm out of ideas then....
no problem, thanks for the help
